feed.title: Combined summary - Transcripts from coredev.tech Amsterdam 2019 meeting

entry.title: Combined summary - Transcripts from coredev.tech Amsterdam 2019 meeting
entry.summary: The notes from the coredev.tech Amsterdam 2019 meeting cover a broad range of topics related to Bitcoin Core development. Bryan Bishop shared these notes in an email thread, which include links to transcripts of various discussions. These links provide detailed insights into different aspects of Bitcoin Core development, such as code review process, problems faced by maintainers, wallet re-architecture, consensus cleanup, SIGHASH_NOINPUT, OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK, OP_CHECKOUTPUTSHASHVERIFY and OP_SECURETHEBAG, taproot discussion, Utreexo, assumeutxo, hardware wallets and HWI, bip151, p2p encryption and v2 message format, signet for bitcoin test networks, and statechains overview. Cory, in response to the email, expressed her gratitude for the valuable notes. The information provided in the notes can be helpful for anyone who wants to gain a deeper understanding of the Bitcoin Core development process.
